title: Can we get some context from RIOT about the Evelynn nerf?
body: Eve hasn't been even doing well in competitive, this nerf seems completely out of the blue.

Also if Yasuo is item reliant then that means shut down Yasuo isn't a champion as he doesn't have items. Yasuo's laning phase is only good on mains as far as I can tell, so he should be fairly easy to shut down.

Meanwhile Zed has a super safe laning phase seeing as he can cs without being punished like other melee champs. He has really good base damage allowing him to all in early. No it isn't clear, especially when you look at her HISTORIC NERFS. Eve has always been nerfed when she's too strong in a given meta, right now she isn't even powerful and her play at almost every level is underwhelming compared to other picks. These nerfs are almost random.

This is why I'm asking for SPECIFIC CONTEXT FROM A RIOT EMPLOYEE, not some speculation by a random player.

We've been looking at a number of regular pro play picks this week, as we approach the lock date for the World's patch in a few days. Eve's one of the champions we've been considering changes to, given her relatively high pick/ban rate in pro play (win rate is sometimes a less reliable stat in pro play given the small sample sizes). Consensus internally's been trending away from changes to her in 5.18 (we believe she's strong, but not excessively so), we've been looking at an E nerf as a way to pull power though if we do conclude it's necessary.

If I understand what you are saying you are nerfing her in precaution for the sake of keeping her out of worlds.

Just wondering why she is not a extremely high priority rework at this point then, as that would make it more understandable as she is kept out of world to keep attention away from her for a rework that will drastically change her play style and you wish to avoid creating more mains of the champion who is high on the rework priority list.

And if she is on a rework list will she be in a group rework like the juggernaughts but featuring stealth champions? (Shaco, Eve, and possibly Kha, Rengar, Akali and Teemo?) As what has been seen from riot is a dislike of the present stealth mechanics in the game.
Oh, no, we'd be very happy seeing some Eve at Worlds. Concern being discussed was that she might be too strong in top level play.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2OhwoYss,comment-id=000c00010000,timestamp=2015-09-09T07:23:02.772+0000)
>
> Oh, no, we'd be very happy seeing some Eve at Worlds. Concern being discussed was that she might be too strong in top level play.

Those two sentences kinda contradict one another. You'd love to see her at worlds, but you're nerfing her out of pro play because she might become strong? She wont be used in worlds at this rate. Clearlove will probably be the only jungler to make good use of her.

It's not contradictory.  There is a difference between "strong enough for pro play" and "*too strong* in pro play".  The concern isn't that Eve is good enough to make appearances at worlds - the concern is that Eve will be a *decider* at Worlds; the type of champ that is 100% Pick/Ban.

I don't really think that's a risk Eve runs, but I'm also not up at the skill level to have that assessment.  Most imporantly, I also don't have a good grasp of what Eve with the new items does, and I suspect that's why they're concerned; environmental changes can do a lot to a champ.

We're currently discussing whether or not we believe Eve is too strong in high level play. If we think she's too strong, we'll nerf her, with the E change currently in testing as a likely way we'd do that. If we conclude she's not too strong we'll leave her as is.

I enjoy seeing what you have to say a lot of times, Meddler, and it always delights me when you speak to us since your fellow Rioters are too shy to. But lately, the past week, what you have to say has been very disappointing.
